trial_identification.studytitle: Angiotensin in Septic Kidney Injury Trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Pilot Crossover Randomised Controlled Trial of Angiotensin II in Critically Ill Patients With Severe Sepsis and Acute Renal Failure

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents
Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Angiotensin II Treatment: drugs - Saline placebo
Active Comparator: Angiotensin II -
Placebo Comparator: Placebo -
Treatment: drugs: Angiotensin II Angiotensin II will be given by continuous infusion for 24 hours starting at a dose of 5ng/kg/min and then titrated to a maximum dose of 15 ng/kg/min according to a blood pressure based protocol
Treatment: drugs: Saline placebo Saline placebo will be given by continuous infusion according to a blood-pressure base protocol. This protocol will also incorporate noradrenaline for blood pressure control (as is true in the active drug arm), such that blood pressure targets will be rapidly achieved in both arms of the study; the only difference being that in the active drug arm, at least part of the pressor effect will be provided by angiotensin II.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: During the 24 hours of infusion of study drug
During the 24 hour infusion of study drug

At the end of the 24 hour infusion of study drug

At the end of the 24 hour infusion of study drug
At the end of the 24 hour infusion of study drug
At the end of the 24 hour infusion of study drug
At the end of the 24 hour infusion of study drug

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- age = 18 years
- within the first 24 hours of ICU admission
- an expected duration of ICU admission of at least 72 hours
- informed consent by patient or by proxy (i.e. next of kin)
- diagnosis of severe sepsis/septic shock
- diagnosis of kidney dysfunction (minimum RIFLE criteria - 'R'); and
- presence of a central venous catheter.

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of a systemic infusion of angiotensin II on haemodynamics and urine output in critically ill patients with severe sepsis/septic shock and acute renal failure.
It will also help determine the feasibility of conducting a definitive and adequately powered randomised controlled trial of angiotensin II in such patients that would assess mortality and need for renal replacement therapy as endpoints.
